Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ObjectMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.ObjectMethods
  • public class ObjectMethods
extends Object
    General methods applicable to objects of any type.

    Container objects

    Some methods in this class apply special logic when passed a container object. A container object is an array, a Collection or a Map. For Map objects the logic will always only applied to their values, not their keys (use Map.keySet() is you want the logic to their keys as well).

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(Object obj)
        Verifies that the object is empty. Returns true if any of the following applies:

        • obj is null
        • obj is an empty CharSequence
        • obj is an empty (zero-size) container object
        • obj is a zero-size Sizeable
        • obj is an empty Emptyable

        Otherwise this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is empty

      • isNotEmpty

        public static boolean isNotEmpty​(Object obj)
        Verifies that the argument is not empty. Returns true if all of the following applies:

        • obj is not null
        • obj is not an empty CharSequence
        • obj is not an empty container object
        • obj is not a zero-size Sizeable
        • obj is not an empty Emptyable
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is empty

      • isDeepNotEmpty

        public static boolean isDeepNotEmpty​(Object obj)
        Verifies that the argument is recursively non-empty. Returns true if any of the following applies:

        • obj is a non-empty CharSequence
        • obj is a non-empty container object with only recursively non-empty elements
        • obj is a non-empty primitive array
        • obj is a non-empty Emptyable
        • obj is a non-zero-size Sizeable
        • obj is a non-null object of any other type
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is recursively non-empty

      • isDeepNotNull

        public static boolean isDeepNotNull​(Object obj)
        Verifies that the argument is not null, not empty, and does not contain any null values.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is not null, not empty, and does not contain any null values

      • isNoneNull

        public static boolean isNoneNull​(Object obj)
        Verifies that the argument is not null and, if it is a container object, does not contain any null values. It may still be an empty (zero-size) container object, however. Useful for testing varargs arrays.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is not null and does not contain any null values

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        obj - The argument
        Returns:
        The argument itself or null

      • e2nEquals

        public static boolean e2nEquals​(Object obj1,
                                Object obj2)
        Tests the provided arguments for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. This is equivalent to Objects.equals(emptyToNull(obj1), emptyToNull(obj2)), except that an empty instance of one type (e.g. String) is not equal to an empty instance of another non-comparable type (e.g. Set). An empty HashSet, however, is equal to an empty TreeSet. So:

        1. null equals an empty CharSequence
        2. null equals an empty Collection
        3. null equals an empty Map
        4. null equals a zero-length array
        5. null equals an empty Emptyable
        6. null equals a zero-size Sizeable
        7. An empty intance of one type never equals an empty instance of another non-comparable type
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The 1st of the pair of objects to compare
        obj2 - The 2nd of the pair of objects to compare
        Returns:
        Whether or not the provided arguments are equal using empty-equals-null semantics

      • e2nDeepEquals

        public static boolean e2nDeepEquals​(Object obj1,
                                    Object obj2)
        Recursively tests the arguments for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. In other words, for container objects elements c.q. values are also compared using e2nDeepEquals.
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The 1st of the pair of objects to compare
        obj2 - The 2nd of the pair of objects to compare
        Returns:
        Whether or not the provided arguments are deeply equal using empty-equals-null semantics

      • e2nHashCode

        public static int e2nHashCode​(Object obj)
        Generates a hash code for the provided object using using empty-equals-null semantics. Consequently, null and empty objects all have the same hash code: 0 (zero). Therefore non-generic maps and sets relying on empty-equals-null semantics will likely have to fall back more often on e2nEquals or e2nDeepEquals.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to generate a hash code for
        Returns:
        The hash code

      • e2nHash

        public static int e2nHash​(Object... objs)
        Generates a hash code for the provided arguments using using empty-equals-null semantics. See Object.hashCode().
        Parameters:
        objs - The objects to generate a hash code for
        Returns:
        The hash code

      • ifTrue

        public static <T> T ifTrue​(boolean condition,
                           T value,
                           UnaryOperator<T> then)
        Returns the result of the specified operation on value if the condition evaluates to true, else value itself. For example: 
         String s = ifTrue(ignoreCase, name, String::toLowerCase);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The input and return type
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        value - The value value to return or to apply the transformation to
        then - The operation to apply if the condition evaluates to true
        Returns:
        value, possibly transformed by the unary operator

        Type Parameters:
        T - The input and return type
        Parameters:
        arg0 - The value to test
        arg1 - The value arg0 must have in order to be returned

      • ifNotNull

        public static <T,​U> U ifNotNull​(T arg,
                                      Function<T,​U> then)
        Returns the result of passing the specified argument to the specified Funtion if the argument is not null, else returns null. For example: 
         String[] strs = ifNotNull("Hello World", s -> s.split(" "));
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the first argument
        U - The return type
        Parameters:
        arg - The value to test
        then - The transformation to apply to the value if it is not null
        Returns:
        value or null

      • ifNotNull

        public static <T,​U> U ifNotNull​(T arg,
                                      Function<T,​U> then,
                                      Supplier<U> otherwise)
        Returns the result of passing the specified argument to the specified Funtion if the argument is not null, else returns the result provided by the specified Supplier. For example: 
         String[] strs = ifNotNull("Hello World", s -> s.split(" "), () -> new String[0]);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the first argument
        U - The return type
        Parameters:
        arg - The value to testdoIfNotNull
        then - The transformation to apply to the value if it is not null
        otherwise - A supplier providing the default value

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        otherwise - The action to execute if the condition to evaluates to false
